alert.note: Alert for Salinas (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 10:54PM ADT until September 19 at 1:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SECTOR SAN FELIPE AND MOSQUITO IN SALINAS... The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Salinas County in Puerto Rico... * Until midnight AST. * At 954 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Sector San Felipe and Mosquito in southern Salinas. Between 10 and 15 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Widespread life-threatening flash flooding requiring multiple swift water rescues are already occurring, mainly in Sector San Felipe and Mosquito in Salinas. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Sector San Felipe and Mosquito in Salinas. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and Emergency Manager reports. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Salinas, Coco, Coqui, Vazquez, Playita, Central Aguirre, La Plena, San Felipe, Mosquito and Las Ochenta. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
